thread.title: CHEAT! Samir Nasri slams Leicester's Jamie Vardy for play-acting in headbutt clash that saw him sent off
thread.title_full: CHEAT! Samir Nasri slams Leicester's Jamie Vardy for play-acting in headbutt clash that saw him sent off

author: James Nursey
title: CHEAT! Samir Nasri slams Leicester's Jamie Vardy for play-acting in headbutt clash that saw him sent off
text:
Nasri admitted wanting a post-match word with Vardy over Tuesday night's flashpoint (Photo: Getty) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Jamie Vardy has been branded a “cheat” by Samir Nasri, who admits he tried to confront the striker after Leicester ’s dramatic Champions League victory. 
Nasri, on loan at Sevilla from Manchester City, was furious following his red-card for a head-butt aimed at striker Vardy during the second half of Tuesday night’s thriller. 
The Foxes went on to beat the 10-men 2-0 — enough to secure their place in the quarter-final draw on Friday morning. 
Nasri said of the England international: “For me, he is a cheat. The two players go nose to nose... (Photo: Sportimage) ...Vardy reels backwards, though Nasri denies making contact... (Photo: Plumb Images/Leicester City/Getty) ..and ref Daniele Orsato shows a red card for the Frenchman's second cautionable offence (Photo: Getty) 
"We went face to face and then he fell on the floor. 
“I thought the English player was tougher than that. He was the one who came to my face, and then went on the floor. He played it well. 
“I didn’t touch him. I didn’t do anything with my head. 
“I would love to speak to him but, you know, too many cameras, too many security — and I have to think about next year and not getting a big suspension.” 
The pair tangled with just under 20 minutes left in the game. 
Nasri, already on a booking, leaned his head into Vardy’s and was shown a second yellow after the striker recoiled on contact. The incident rumbled on after Nasri's dismissal... (Photo: Rex Features) ..before team-mates finally talked him into leaving the pitch (Photo: Rex Features) 
It has been claimed in France that Vardy insulted the midfielder’s family. 
Nasri admitted: “I should have thought about it before and been smarter. 
“If he was a foreign player, English people would say he is a cheat. 
"They were winning 2-0, play the game like a man - win it. You are not better than us but you are winning 2-0, you will qualify, just play the game. You have quality, you are an international player, you don’t need to do that. 
“I think it started with a foul or something. Then he pushed me and I said, ‘What are you doing?’ Then he came in my face. That’s what happened. 
“I was surprised but, like I said, I should have thought about it and not reacted. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
